intro: Onagra pellucida, commonly known as false flax, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round seeds that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and disturbed areas. Onagra pellucida is also known for its historical use in treating digestive ailments and as a source of oil.
